adverbs.description: wetly (comparative more wetly, superlative most wetly)

examples: They lay on one another in heaps, or attempted to crawl about—some itching madly with leprosies—some swollen and gasping with dropsies—some wetly reeking, like hands washed in winter-time.

entries.meaning: (UK, informal) Ineffectually, feebly, showing no strength of character.
examples: Rupert Frazer reveals the hollowness behind the elder Forsyth's tyrannical bluster, while Geoff Breton does all that is possible to reconcile us to his wetly conventional son.
